intro: Heteropterys pragua, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit tree, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible, star-shaped fruits that are often consumed raw or cooked. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts within its native habitat.
